item.title: Avoid Bicycle Thefts in Toronto Using Historical Data
item.description: Abstract Toronto bicycle route infrastructure is quickly growing, but the city suffers from large cases of bicycle thefts. After making observations on historical bicycle data, we have observed that bicycle theft is very common in Toronto. Despite this, the data has shown that riders should take proactive measures to avoid bike theft such as: registering their bike with the Toronto Police, avoid parking in areas with high theft occurrences such as West Spadina and Yonge/South of Bloor, and properly securing their bike (both wheels and frame) on grounded sturdy objects (eg.

item.title: About
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.
